intro: Spergularia rubra var. sperguloides, commonly known as red sandwort, is a flowering plant in the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its dense clusters of small, pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in coastal or inland dunes. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. This variety is well adapted to harsh environments and is often found in areas with poor soil conditions.
